description.value:
You shout a command that's hard to ignore. You can command the target to approach you, run away (as if it had the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Fleeing] condition), release what it's holding, drop @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Prone], or stand in place. It can't @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.Delay] or take any reactions until it has obeyed your command. The effects depend on the target's Will save.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure For the first action on its next turn, the creature must use a single action to do as you command.

Critical Failure The target must use all its actions on its next turn to obey your command.

Heightened (5th) You can target up to 10 creatures.

duration.value: until the end of the target's next turn

description.value:
You push into the target's mind and daze it with a mental jolt. The jolt deals 1d6 mental damage, with a basic Will save. If the target critically fails the save, it is also @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Stunned]{Stunned 1}.

Heightened (+2) The damage increases by 1d6.

You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies. You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower rank than the rank of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.equipment.Item.Invisibility Potion]) typically are detected normally.

Heightened (3rd) You learn the rank or level of the most powerful magical effect the spell detects, as determined by the GM.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd rank, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-rank magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

You fire a shard of solidified magic toward a creature that you can see. It automatically hits and deals 1d4+1 force damage. For each additional action you use when Casting the Spell, increase the number of shards you shoot by one, to a maximum of three shards for 3 actions. You choose the target for each shard individually. If you shoot more than one shard at the same target, combine the damage before applying bonuses or penalties to damage, resistances, weaknesses, and so forth.

Heightened (+2) You fire one additional shard with each action you spend.

You create an orb of light that sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light for the next 20 feet) in a color you choose. If you create the light in the same space as a willing creature, you can attach the light to the creature, causing it to float near that creature as it moves. You can Sustain the spell to move the light up to 60 feet; you can attach or detach it from a creature as part of this movement.

You can Dismiss the spell. If you Cast the Spell while you already have four light spells active, you must choose one of the existing spells to end.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spell-effects.Item.Spell Effect: Light]

Heightened (4th) The orb sheds light in a 60-foot radius (and dim light for the next 60 feet).

You overload a creature's mind with a glut of psychic information or divine judgments. The mental onslaught deals 2d6 mental damage. On a critical failure, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Stupefied]{Stupefied 2} for 1 round.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d6.

You raise a magical shield of force. This counts as using the Raise a Shield action, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use.

While the spell is in effect, you can use the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feats.Item.Shield Block] reaction with your magic shield. The shield has Hardness 5. You can use the spell's reaction to reduce damage from any spell or magical effect, even if it doesn't deal physical damage. After you use Shield Block, the spell ends and you can't cast it again for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spell-effects.Item.Spell Effect: Shield]

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spell-effects.Item.Effect: Shield Immunity]

Heightened (+2) The shield's Hardness increases by 5.

duration.value: until the start of your next turn

description.value:
You call upon the Void to harm life force. The target takes 2d4 void damage with a basic Fortitude save. On a critical failure, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Enfeebled]{Enfeebled 1} until the start of your next turn.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.

Upgrades: 1

This pistol automatically ejects used cartridges and loads new ammunition after every shot fired.

Upgrades: 1

This flexible nanocarbon circuit can be installed as an upgrade into gloves, kneepads, or similar appendage protectors to emit a powerful electric shock when forcefully applied to a target.

Upgrades: 1

A projector fastened to a belt or lapel encases the wearer's body in this shimmering hardlight shell. Military-issue hardlight armor follows a predictable standard, but private users enjoy a range of customizable fashion options.

A hacking toolkit is required for Computers checks to Hack computers. You can use a hacking toolkit to access a computer without using a user interface, but this requires physical contact with the computer or contact via an infosphere or a similar linked network.

You need an infiltrator's toolkit to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.Pick a Lock]{Pick Locks} or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.Disable a Device]{Disable Devices} (of some types) using the Thievery skill.

A repair toolkit contains a variety of delicate tools and supplies that allows you to perform simple repairs while traveling. You can use a repair toolkit to Repair items using the Crafting skill. You can draw and replace a worn repair toolkit as part of the action that uses it.

Activate 1 (manipulate)

When you inject this serum, magitech nanites infuse your body with machine-like circuitry that pulses and glows beneath your skin. For 1 minute, you gain a +1 item bonus to saving throws against mental effects. You also gain resistance 5 to mental damage. Due to your more machine-like nature, you gain weakness 5 to electricity.

items.name: +1 to Saves Vs Disease, Mental, Poison, Radiation

description.value:
Frequency once per hour

Trigger Whisper in the Code attempts a skill action that takes 3 or fewer actions

Effect Whisper in the Code stimulates their nanites, forcing their body to temporarily increase its efficiency. They gain a +2 status bonus to the triggering skill check. In addition, their circuitry glows, lighting a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] with dim light for 1 round.
If the next action Whisper in the Code takes is to Cast a Spell that has a range, increase that spell's range by 30 feet.
